Package myMath

Class Monom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Monom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, function
    public class Monom
extends Object
implements function
    This class represents a simple "Monom" of shape a*x^b, where a is a real number and b is an integer (summed a none negative), see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monomial The class implements function and support simple operations as: construction, value at x, derivative, add and multiply.
    Author:
    Ido Shapira & Edut Cohen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isZero

        public boolean isZero()
        this method checks whether our monom is the Zero monom defined at the beginning of the code
        Returns:
        true if it's the zero monom, false otherwise

      • isTheMonomValid

        private boolean isTheMonomValid​(String s)
        the method checks if we can build a new monom from a given string according to the form of a*x^b when a is a real number and b is a non negative integer
        Parameters:
        s - the string we now check
        Returns:
        true is s is a legal form of a monom, false otherwise.

      • isCoefficientValid

        private boolean isCoefficientValid​(String s)
        this method is a sub- method of isTheMonomValid. this method checks whether the coefficient is legal.
        Parameters:
        s - the may-be coefficient we now check
        Returns:
        true if s is a legal coefficient, false otherwise.

      • isPowerValid

        private boolean isPowerValid​(String s)
        this method is a sub- method of isTheMonomValid. this method checks whether the power value is legal.
        Parameters:
        s - the may-be power value we now check
        Returns:
        true if s is a legal power value, false otherwise.

      • add

        public void add​(Monom m)
        this method adds the given monom to our monom if it is possible (the power values are equal)
        Parameters:
        m - the monom we want to add

      • multipy

        public void multipy​(Monom d)
        this method multiplies the given monom by our monom and save the result in our monom
        Parameters:
        d - the monom we want to multiply by
